email.subject: ASAP: Wire Transfer Authorization
email.body:
I'm in meetings all day but need you to process a $15,126 wire transfer ASAP. Same vendor as usual. Handle this quietly.

Thanks,
David Martinez
CFO

results.explanation:
Overview:
- Threat Level: MEDIUM (0.466)
- Similarity=0.131 | Confidence: 0.638 | Rank: 1

Key Indicators:
- executive_impersonation 1.0 – Appears to mimic an executive or authority
- urgent_language 0.7 – Urgent wording requesting immediate action
- financial_request 0.6 – Payment / transfer instructions present
- outside_hours 0.4 – Sent outside typical business hours

Risk Summary:
- Financial request coupled with urgency signals potential payment fraud; Possible executive impersonation (business email compromise pattern)

Recommended Action:
- Verify sender authenticity and scrutinize any financial or credential requests.

Analysis Detail:
⚠️ HIGH RISK INDICATORS:
  • Potential executive impersonation detected (confidence: 100.0%)
  • Contains urgent language requiring immediate action (confidence: 70.0%)
  • Requests financial information or transactions (confidence: 60.0%)

⚡ MODERATE RISK INDICATORS:
  • Sent outside typical business hours (confidence: 40.0%)

Subject: ASAP: Wire Transfer Authorization...
